abstract: An animation that starts quickly and then slows towards the end of the movement.
overview:
## Return Value

An ease-out animation with the default duration.

## Discussion

An easing animation provides motion with a natural feel by varying the acceleration and deceleration of the animation, which matches how things tend to move in reality. With an ease out animation, the motion starts quickly and decreases its speed towards the end.

The `easeOut` animation has a default duration of 0.35 seconds. To specify a different duration, use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Animation/easeOut(duration:)].

The following code shows an example of animating the size changes of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Circle] using an ease out animation.

items.description: An animation that starts slowly and then increases speed towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeIn

items.description: An animation with a specified duration that starts slowly and then increases speed towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeIn(duration:)

items.description: An animation with a specified duration that starts quickly and then slows towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeOut(duration:)

items.description: An animation that combines the behaviors of in and out easing animations.
items.name: easeInOut

items.description: An animation with a specified duration that combines the behaviors of in and out easing animations.
items.name: easeInOut(duration:)

title: easeOut
